favourite.article: Looked this up to learn it by heart. This was a favorite hymn of Hudson Taylor (the great missionary to inland China) as he absolutely needed to rest in Jesus in the face of insurmountable challenges. More than anything, I am encouraged by the comments here, this morning-----just proof that the Lord is calling to mind "psalms, hymns and spiritual songs" to keep us all going/trusting Him in these dark days. He lives!

Seeing Jesus in Hebrews 1 as the radiance of God's glory and the exact representation of His being, I was reminded of this hymn and delighted in two lines of the last verse - "Brightness of my Father’s glory, Sunshine of my Father’s face,"

This wonderful song I sing over and over to myself as life falls apart around me. It used to scare me, but now as I "rest in Jesus", He assures me He is really all I ever need. Praise His wonderful name!
What a hymn this is! It has now become my favorite hymn.
Out of nowhere this song came to mind this morning as I was opening God's Word resulting in spontaneous praise. But I couldn't remember the rest! So here you are and here I am! Grateful!
What lovely words. Old hymn, thrills my soul.
I love this hymn! Even put it on my homescreen to learn by heart.
I love verse 3. How comforting that is, how He satisfies our heart and deepest longings…and supplies our every need! How applicable that is to me now...
How dear the Savior! How joyously satisfying is Christ the Lord!
We used to sing this when I was a child. I am now 80. Was led to sing it today, forget some of the words and PTL found them here:-)
It is the daily trusting and watching how Father keeps His promises that give life the 'edge' today...1 Cor 1:9
Isaiah 30:15 "For thus saith the Lord GOD, the Holy One of Israel; In returning and rest shall ye be saved; in quietness and in confidence shall be your strength: and ye would not."
Amen also. If Jesus stepped into our busy lives today, I think He would say, "Come ye apart and rest awhile...Be still..."
Amen! Just to rest in the joy of Him is something we need to do everyday. Simply resting in Him is enjoyment.... Lord, help me to rest in You every day!
